sanskrit_verse:
एते राष्ट्रे वर्तमाना राज्ञः प्रच्छन्नतस्कराः ।
विकर्मक्रियया नित्यं बाधन्ते भद्रिकाः प्रजाः ॥ ९.२२६॥
transliteration:
ete rāṣṭre vartamānā rājñaḥ pracchannataskarāḥ |
vikarmakriyayā nityaṃ bādhante bhadrikāḥ prajāḥ || 9.226 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: Those who dwell within the nation under the king's rule, yet engage in covert thievery through wrongful action, perpetually harm the welfare of the subjects.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority is derived from alignment with Dharma, not mere positional power.
Causation arises from conscious intent and its sequential manifestation in action.
Capacity-based responsibility demands recognition of one's role in systemic integrity.
Restoration logic requires identification and cessation of hidden malfeasance.
Consciousness alignment necessitates transparency and rectification of concealed harm.

IF any act labeled as 'state function' results in subject harm due to隐蔽_wrongdoing THEN full restorative liability transfers to the executing entity.
ALL隐蔽_wrongdoing cases SHALL trigger mandatory consciousness audit protocols for involved parties.
